intro: Linkia juniperina, commonly known as the Juniper Tree of Madagascar, is a unique evergreen shrub or small tree native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Cupressaceae family, which includes cypresses and junipers, and is characterized by its needle-like leaves and small, cone-like fruits. The plant is adapted to the dry, arid conditions of its native habitat, with a thick cuticle on its leaves to reduce water loss. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of plant adaptation and biodiversity in Madagascar.
